summary: This is a magazine article from New York Magazine profiling the lifestyles and social circles of billionaires in the mid-2000s. It focuses on their exclusive gatherings, personal freedoms, and scandals, with significant detail on Jeffrey Epstein's legal troubles related to underage girls and the social world of figures like Ron Burkle.

persons.name: Vanessa Grigoriadis
persons.context: Author of the New York Magazine article profiling billionaires.

persons.name: Jeny Yang
persons.context: Mentioned as attending the nightclub 'Door' after a Yahoo board meeting.

persons.name: David Filo
persons.context: Mentioned as attending the nightclub 'Door' after a Yahoo board meeting.

persons.name: Sergey Brin
persons.context: Described as attending 'Door' and noted for guarding his privacy, owning a Boeing 767, and living in Palo Alto.

persons.name: Larry Page
persons.context: Described as attending 'Door' and noted for guarding his privacy, owning a Boeing 767, and living in Palo Alto.

persons.name: Ron Burkle
persons.context: Profiled extensively as a social fixture, friend of President Clinton, involved in charity, and subject of a shakedown attempt by a reporter.

persons.name: Richard Branson
persons.context: Mentioned as attending 'Door' and pledging profits to renewable energy.

persons.name: Steve Bing
persons.context: Described as a down-to-earth Democratic donor who inherited wealth and pledged $1 billion to renewable energy.

persons.name: President Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as someone billionaires like Ron Burkle hang out with and work with; advance men for him are noted.

persons.name: Danny A.
persons.context: Friend of Ron Burkle who runs the nightclub 'Door' and went on a trip to Israel with President Clinton.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a womanizer whose lifestyle was made public; accused of having underage girls massage him and allegedly having sex with them in Palm Beach.

persons.name: Stewart Rahr
persons.context: Mentioned as someone a friend sat next to at a social event.

persons.name: Ian Schrager
persons.context: Mentioned as being seen at a social event, with debate over whether he is a billionaire.

persons.name: Steve Wynn
persons.context: Described as buying a Picasso, accidentally damaging it, and deciding to keep it.

persons.name: Steve Cohen
persons.context: Mentioned as the prospective buyer of the Picasso that Steve Wynn damaged.

persons.name: Warren Buffett
persons.context: Noted for donating $31 billion to the Gates Foundation and planning to give away most of his fortune.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Mentioned as co-founder of the foundation receiving Buffett's donation.

persons.name: Melinda Gates
persons.context: Mentioned as co-founder of the foundation receiving Buffett's donation.

persons.name: Leonardo DiCaprio
persons.context: Mentioned as sharing a pied-a-terre under renovation with Ron Burkle.

persons.name: Petra Nemcova
persons.context: Mentioned as having a charity benefit for tsunami victims to which Ron Burkle contributed $200,000.

persons.name: Jared Paul Stern
persons.context: Described as a writer of questionable integrity who allegedly tried to shake down Ron Burkle, caught on tape.

persons.name: Mike Sitrick
persons.context: Part of Ron Burkle's security apparatus, brought in to manage Bruce McMahan's scandal.

persons.name: Frank Renzi
persons.context: Part of Ron Burkle's security apparatus, formerly in President Clinton's Secret Service detail.

persons.name: Bruce McMahan
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Mike Sitrick was brought in to help when accused of an affair with his daughter.

persons.name: Roustam Tariko
persons.context: Described as throwing a lavish party at the Statue of Liberty and rumored to buy a Picasso.

persons.name: Helena Christensen
persons.context: Mentioned as a guest at Roustam Tariko's party.

persons.name: Donna Karan
persons.context: Mentioned as a guest at Roustam Tariko's party.

persons.name: Lillian Ross
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Roustam Tariko told about not buying a Picasso.

persons.name: The Dalai Lama
persons.context: Mentioned as being flown by Ron Burkle from New York and back at the California governor's request.

connections.description: Burkle works with and is a friend of President Clinton; he went on a trip to Israel with him and hosts events for him.
Danny A. is a friend of Burkle's and runs the nightclub 'Door' that Burkle frequents.
They share a pied-a-terre under renovation in New York.
A then-17-year-old brought at least five high-school girls aged 14-16 to Epstein's house for 'massages' which involved sexual acts.
Stern allegedly tried to shake down Burkle, who caught him on tape.
Sitrick is part of Burkle's security and crisis management team.
Renzi is part of Burkle's security apparatus, formerly with Clinton's Secret Service.
Google co-founders mentioned together attending events and sharing a private jet.
Wynn was showing a Picasso to Cohen for a potential $139 million sale when he damaged it.

events.title: Epstein's Lifestyle Revealed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was humiliated when his lifestyle was made public, including allegations of sexual misconduct with underage girls.

events.title: Nightclub 'Door' Operations
events.description: The exclusive nightclub 'Door' operates in Chelsea, frequented by billionaires and models, with strict entry controlled by promoter Danny A.

events.title: Buffett's Donation to Gates Foundation
events.description: Warren Buffett donated $31 billion to the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for education and global development.

events.title: Burkle Shakedown Attempt
events.description: Ron Burkle caught 'Page Six' writer Jared Paul Stern on tape allegedly trying to shake him down, leading to increased publicity.

events.title: Wynn Damages Picasso
events.description: Steve Wynn accidentally ripped a hole in a Picasso with his elbow while showing it to Steve Cohen before a potential $139 million sale.

events.title: Tariko's Statue of Liberty Party
events.description: Roustam Tariko hosted an extravagant party at the foot of the Statue of Liberty for over a thousand guests to launch his vodka brand.

locations: Private island in the Virgin Islands (Epstein's business location)
Sky Studios, lower Broadway, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was accused of having underage girls, aged 14-16, brought to his Palm Beach house to 'massage' him, which involved sexual acts; his defense claimed he didn't know they were minors.

The exclusive nightclub 'Door' in Chelsea was a gathering place for billionaires like Sergey Brin, Larry Page, Ron Burkle, and Richard Branson, with entry tightly controlled by promoter Danny A., a friend of Burkle's.

Ron Burkle, a supermarket billionaire and Democratic donor, worked closely with President Clinton, had a sophisticated security team, and was the target of an alleged shakedown by 'Page Six' writer Jared Paul Stern.
The article profiles the extreme wealth and social circles of mid-2000s billionaires, highlighting their philanthropy, scandals, and lifestyles, including Epstein's abuse allegations.

Billionaires like Warren Buffett and Richard Branson were noted for major philanthropic pledges, while others like Steve Wynn and Roustam Tariko were involved in high-stakes art dealings and lavish parties.
